art.author: lisa
art.post: I seldom read spiritual books.Not because I don’t believe, but I find them boring. This book however literaly jumped into my hands. A few weeks ago I was in a Goodwill store browsing through the book section. A paperback book fell off the shelf. I picked it up, turned it over, read the title, and placed it back on the shelf. If fell off the shelf again! landing right at my feet. This time I looked at the back of the book and read the description. Something about the book said “read me”. I bought the book and read it in a few days. Normally it takes me weeks to read this type of book. But I couldn’t put it down!Years ago I had a NDE, I seldom speak of it for fear of the ridicule I would receive. This book touched those memories and the picture of Jesus is the memory I have of the man I met in “The Garden”. I find comfort and strength again in the knowledge that He is watching over us all.
art.title: Akiane’s Jesus, Heaven is for Real and the Man in the Turin Shroud
